nodes.text: Esyam was a planet of molten rock that was located within the Y'Toub system of the galaxy's Hutt Space region. The planet occupied the first orbital position around its star, Y'Toub, and lay on the junction of four hyperlanes called the Oktos Route, the Ootmian Pabol, the Pabol Hutta, and the Shag Pabol.

Esyam was a molten rock planet with no moons that was located within the Y'Toub system of the galaxy's Hutt Space region. The planet occupied the first orbital position around its star, Y'Toub, and lay on the junction of four hyperlanes called the Oktos Route, the Ootmian Pabol, the Pabol Hutta, and the Shag Pabol. The Oktos Route connected Esyam to the planet of Kleeva while the Ootmian Pabol linked the planet to the world of Du Hutta. In addition to that, the routes of Pabol Hutta and Shag Pabol joined Esyam with the planets of Hosko and Rorak 4, respectively.
The territory surrounding Esyam had come under the control of the Hutt species approximately by the year 12,000 BBY and was considered well-explored by 8000 BBY.

Esyam was first pictured in the entry for the planet of Nal Hutta in The Holonet feature of the official website for Star Wars: The Old Republic—a 2011 massively multiplayer online roleplaying game developed by BioWare. Esyam was depicted in a schematic of the Y'Toub system. Since its establishment in 2008, The Old Republic's website has gone through a number of changes, resulting in the removal of some of the features and images that were originally located there, including the aforementioned schematic. Esyam's name was first mentioned in The Essential Atlas—a reference book co-authored by Jason Fry and Daniel Wallace, and published on August 18, 2009—which placed the planet in grid square S-12.
